1.title: Hopes and Fears
1.plot: Detectives Hell and High-water do some generic police digging around and craziness follows in this high speed comedy farce. David Havell cameos as the disagreeing racist superior.

2.title: Meat Grinder
2.plot: Greg is an outstanding head boatman on day #2 on the South Fork of the American River, but faces a personal crisis the following day. Students are expected to perform like seasoned river guides.

3.title: Opt Out/Eddy Out
3.plot: Sara takes over as head boatman on the upper Sacramento River. Physical and mental challenges plague the group. Several of the students face an uncertain future in the guide school.

4.title: The Road to Hell
4.plot: Jay is the leader on the worst day in the history of the guide school. Numerous obstacles and problems confront the students and instructors as they make their way to the imposing upper Klamath River. Tempers start to flare.

5.title: Hell's Corner
5.plot: Amanda leads the group as it runs the upper Klamath River for the second day. Breaking through the Bermuda Triangle and barely escaping the deadly clutches of the Dragon, the students make their way through Hell's Corner.

6.title: Run-Off
6.plot: Emotions reach a breaking point as the strain of expedition travel starts to take its toll on the students. Linsey is the head boatman and must guide the group down the Scott River as they face off against their instructors, each other, and their own fears and doubts.

7.title: Flood Stage
7.plot: The increasingly difficulty of the water on the Scott River has both damaging and healing effects. While some students are facing defeat at the hands of these powerful rivers, Chuck, today's boatman, is finding strength and purpose.

8.title: The Gaping Maw
8.plot: Students must escape the jaws of one of the biggest holes they will ever run in their rigorous whitewater training. The Cal-Salmon is at record high. The river has been changed by bulging flows and fear paralyzes the students. The group rebels against head boatman, Guy.

9.title: Hell to Pay
9.plot: The second day on the Cal-Salmon. The students, under the leadership of Marie, are guiding themselves through the Gaping Maw and onto the even larger Ikes. Swimming in these icy waters will be inevitable and pain is a certainty.

10.title: To Hell and Back
10.plot: On the last day of training, in record-high water on the Cal-Salmon, the students face rapids even veteran river guides refuse to run. Kyle is the head boatman and the mystical river terrorizes and empowers the group on its graduation day.

imdb.plot outline: While some may think fire and water don't mix, this one-hour episodic show will prove otherwise as it follows the trials and tribulations of 13 students as they attempt to successfully navigate seven of America's most dangerous rivers in their quest to become world-class river guides. Known for its "trial by fire" tactics, The Wilderness Adventures Guide School is infamous in the industry for its hands-on, on-river approach. Despite the fact that the instructors adamantly believe it is the best way for potential whitewater guides to learn river running, the extreme conditions both on and off the water will have some running for the hills. "As we take them down these seven wild rivers, we are going to shove whitewater down their throats," said Roger Lee, one of the lead instructors. This force-feeding style may be tough for the students to swallow, but audiences around the globe will eat it up. After all, as the 13 would-be rafting guides navigate dangerous waters and volatile relationships, the drama will flow as fast as the Class-5 rivers.
imdb.title: Hell & Highwater
plot: Thirteen students battle seven treacherous rivers as they seek to fulfill their one goal of becoming a world-class whitewater river guide.::Brian Bose

While some may think fire and water don't mix, this one-hour episodic show will prove otherwise as it follows the trials and tribulations of 13 students as they attempt to successfully navigate seven of America's most dangerous rivers in their quest to become world-class river guides. Known for its "trial by fire" tactics, The Wilderness Adventures Guide School is infamous in the industry for its hands-on, on-river approach. Despite the fact that the instructors adamantly believe it is the best way for potential whitewater guides to learn river running, the extreme conditions both on and off the water will have some running for the hills. "As we take them down these seven wild rivers, we are going to shove whitewater down their throats," said Roger Lee, one of the lead instructors. This force-feeding style may be tough for the students to swallow, but audiences around the globe will eat it up. After all, as the 13 would-be rafting guides navigate dangerous waters and volatile relationships, the drama will flow as fast as the Class-5 rivers.::Brian Bose
